overview: This file controls the various statistics for each type of pet from all the classes summon Skills  Any column field name starting with “*” is considered a comment field and is not used by the game

data_fields.name: pet type
data_fields.description: Defines the name of the pet type, used in the “pettype” column in skills.txt

data_fields.name: group
data_fields.description: Used as an ID field, where if pet types share the same group value, then only 1 pet of that group is allowed to be alive at any time. If equals 0 (or null), then ignore this.

data_fields.name: basemax
data_fields.description: This sets a baseline maximum number of pets allowed to be alive when skill levels are reset or changed.

data_fields.name: warp
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then the Pet will teleport to the player when the player teleports or warps to another area. If equals 0, then the pet will die instead.

data_fields.name: range
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then the Pet will die if the player teleports or warps to another area and is located more than 40 grid tiles in distances from the Pet. If equals 0, then ignore this.

data_fields.name: partysend
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then tell the Pet to do the Party Location Update command (find the location of its Player) when its health changes. If equals 0, then ignore this.

data_fields.name: unsummon
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then the Pet can be unsummoned by the Unsummon skill function. If equals 0, then the Pet cannot be unsummoned.

data_fields.name: automap
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then display the Pet on the Automap. If equals 0, then hide the pet on the Automap.

data_fields.name: name
data_fields.description: String Key. Used to define the Pet’s name on its party frame

data_fields.name: drawhp
data_fields.description: Boolean field. If equals 1, then display the Pet’s Life bar under the party frame. If equals 0, then hide the Pet’s Life bar under the party icon.

data_fields.name: icontype
data_fields.description: Controls the functionality for how to display the Pet Icon and number of Pets counter Code 0 1 2 Description Do not display the Pet icon Display the Pet icon and do not show the Pet counter Display the Pet icon and show the Pet counter

data_fields.name: baseicon
data_fields.description: Define which DC6 file to use for the default Pet’s icon in its party frame

data_fields.name: mclass1 (to mclass4)
data_fields.description: Defines the alternative pet to use for the “pet type” by using that specific unit’s “hcIdx” from Monstats.txt

data_fields.name: micon1 (to micon4)
data_fields.description: Defines which DC6 file to use for the related “mclass” Pet’s icon in its party frame
